raigned onely two three yeares againe thirty three thirty conanus succeeded vortiporus many victory saxon foure yeares raigne died succeeded malgo conanus raigned six yeares careticus setting upon saxon beaten led towne chichester whereupon saxon catching certaine sparrowes fastning fire feete let fly towne lighting upon traw matter apt take fire whole city short space burnt thereupon careticus flying secured himselfe amongst mountaines wale dyed unprosperously raigned three yeares time forth britaines lost whole kingdome east part island confined west river severne dee careticus succeeded spread selfe easterne world cadwallo succeeded sonne cadwalladar whose time great famine afterward mortality hapned continuing eleven yeares land became manner desolate much king many lord driven abbey glastenbery devotion see rome injoyned every one subject possessed house one kinde good value nineteene penny pay yearely upon lammas day one penny pope first contributed name king almes afterward paid name peter penny last hee went rome tooke upon habit religion therein died wife also became veyled nunne afterward made abbesse barking neere london thirteenth king cuthred first permitted body dead buried within wall city used bee buried field foureteenth sigebert cruelty exaction subject forced fly wood hide himselfe swinherd hee slaine fifteenth kenwolph founded cathedrall church st andrew well afterward slaine kynoard banished sixteenth king brithrick whose queene ethelburg prepared poyson another king chanced tast thereof died feare chance queene fled france charles king excellent beauty offered choyce himselfe sonne marriage lustfull humour choosing son thereupon debard thrust monastery committing adultery driven thence ended life great misery sake west saxon ordained law king wife hereafter title majesty queene many yeares severely executed fourth kingdome east saxon fourth kingdom heptarchy east saxon began erchenwyn yeare containing essex middlesex continued year raignes foureteene king third sebert first built cathedrall st paul london formerly beene temple diana likewise founded church st peter west london place called thorny time stood temple apollo overthrowne earthquake king lucius new built service god againe decayed king restored greater beauty queene athelgarda buried ninth king sebba thirty yeares peaceable raigne relinquished crowne tooke upon religious habit monastery st paul london dying body intumbed coffin gray marble cover coaped yet standeth north wall chancell church twelveth offa famous beauty countenance enlarged building enriched land church westminster eight yeares raigne went rome shorne monke habit died fourteenth suthred egbert king west saxon subdued made kingdome province owne thus besides former shire two also lopped britaines dominion fourth impairing fifth kingdome northumberland fifth kingdome northumberland began ella ida yeare containing yorkeshire durham lancashire westmerland cumberland northumberland continued yeares raignes three twenty king nothing recorded two first builded castle bamburg seventh king ethelfryd caerlegion westchester made slaughter twelve hundred christian monkes himselfe afterward slaine redwald king east angle thirteenth king osred whose wife cutburga loathing wearinesse wedlocke sued divorce husband built nunnery winburne dorsetshire religious habit ended life sixteenth king cednulph eight yeares raigne left royall robe put habit monke isle lindesfern holy island unto king venerable b de saxon priest monastery peter paul werimouth neere durham dedicate worke english history hee continued first entrance saxon island yeare containing owne account yeares seventeenth king egbert twenty yeares raigne forsooke world also shore himselfe monke whosebrother archbishop yorke erected notable library stored infinite number learned bookes last king oswald kingdome yeelded protection egbert king west saxon yeare become absolute monarch whole island thus first christian king mercians laid foundation faire church medeshamstead called peterborough seventh king ethelred raigned thirty yeares nd gave crowne became monke monastery bradney lincolnshire yeare died eighth king kenred foure yeares raigne went rome tooke upon habit monke foure yeares dyed tenth king ethelbald first given much lasciviousnesse life reprehended boniface archbishop ments countrey people commanded restore backe againe made english angry made whole country welsh well pleased sound forth praise pious act built prepared seven forty monastery meant made fifty prevented archbishop canterbury chiefe contented pay ten thousand pound upon condition quietly depart realme served turne present farre satisfying give greater appetite yeare following came againe greater fleet king prepared competent navy committed elfricke earle mercia proving treacherous indeed part king imployed dane allyanced blood dan prevailed next composition sixteene thousand pound given yeare twenty thousand every yeare till came last forty thousand meanes land emptyed coyne english brought low faine till eare ground whilest dane sate idle ate fruite labour abusing wife daughter host lay yet every place every feare called lorddanes afterward became word derision one would signifie lazy lubber distressed state king last bethought himselfe course sent forth secret commission every city within dominion appointed time massacre dane amongst day thirteenth november festivall saint bricius yeare command accordingly performed rigour oxford dane refuge tooke church saint frideswyde along east gate west king levyed army made generall earle edricke great favourite created duke mercia given daughter edgyth marriage yet great favour could keepe treacherous sent embassadour dane good successe treachery turning dane hindered dane proceeded victoriously gotten part land even london also submission whereupon unfortunate king ethelred sending wife emma two sonnes edward alfred brother duke normandy himselfe also winter following passed thither leaving dane lording realme sweyne absolute king extorted english victual pay souldiers demanding composition preserving saint edmunds monastery suffolke inhabitant able therefore refused pay thereupon threatned spoyle place martyr bone interred suddenly middest jollity saith hoveden cryed strucke saint edmund sword midst lord man seeing whose hand came great horrour torment three dayes af er upon third february ended life thetford others say gaynsborough would thinke faire opportunity offered english free wholly branch england never like trouble land indeed appearance probability could true saying shall let done turkill dane revolted king ethelred growing sensible fault way redeemed tender countryman case sherostan another battaile fought dane like againe discomfited traiterous edrick perceiving cut head souldier like unto king edm nd haire countenance shaking bloody sword gasping head cried army english fly ye wretch flie get away king slain behold head king edmund notice treacherous stratagem hasted shew might best seen whose sight encouraged men gotten day finall victory night prevented duke edrick excused fact mistaken countenance man desirous save blood english upon false colour hee received favour againe canutus secretly night brake campe marched towards london sort still besieged danish ship king edmund hearing departure followed small adoe removed siege triumphant manner entred city neere unto otford kent another great battaile fought canutus lost foure thousand five hundred men king edmund onely six hundred rest dane saving light king edmund pur ued thought day ended warres betweene two nation ever ever traiterous edrick kept king edmund pursuing telling ambush danger canutu leisure passe essex thither also king edmund followed ashdone three mile saffron walden another battaile fought dane point overthrowne traiterous edrick force revoulted side treachery english lost day died king edmunds nobility duke alfred duke goodwyn duke athelward duke athelwyn earle urchill codnoth bishop lincolne woolsey abbot ramsey many remembrance battaile retained day certaine small hils remaining whence beene digged bone men armour horsebridles dereherst neere river severn another battaile ready fought suddenly certaine captaine step forth saving blood u ed great perswasions either try matter single combat else divide kingdome betwixt upon combat agreed two prince entering small island called alney adjoyning city glocester compleat armour assayled first horsebacke foote canutus received dangerous wound finding himselfe overmatched strength desired compromise loud voyce used word necessity move u valiant prince obtaining title endanger life better lay malice aside condescend loving agreement let u therefore become sworne brother divide kingdome u motion king edmund accepted thus kingdome divided betweene two prince edmund enjoying part lie upon coast france canutus rest duke edrick hath last greatest act treachery play king edmund retired place nature n cessity thurst draught sharpe speare body cutting head presented canutus fawning word hayle thou sole monarch england behold head thy copartner thy sake adventured cut canutus though ambitious enough soveraignty yet aba hed disloyall fact replyed vowed reward service head bee advanced peeres kingdom soone performed command false edricks head cut placed upon highest gate london death king manner say acted oxford died naturall sicknesse london howsoever came death raigne onely seven month body buried glasten ury neere grandfather king edgar king edmund wife algyt two sonnes eldest named edward surnamed outlaw lived england hungary banished man feare king canutus uncle king edward confessor obtained crowne recalled honourably entertained till died married agatha sister queene sophia wife salomon king hungarie daughter emperour henry second edgar surnamed atheling right heire english crowne though never enjoyed king edmund also two daughter margaret christian younger became veyled nunne ramsey hampshire elder margaret sole heire saxon monarchie married malcolme third king scotland princely bed lineall descent high mighty monarch king iames first doth royall person unite britaines saxon norman scottish imperiall crownes one first danish king england canutus possest halfe kingdome composition king edmund death seised upon whole prevent question called councell english nobility wherein propounded whether agreement betwixt edm nd claime title crowne beene reserved king edmunds brother sonnes daring say otherwise absolutely answered thereupon tooke oath allegeance canutus thus cleered opposite prepared great solemnity coronation performed london hand levingus surnamed elstane archbishop canterbury yeare first dane raigned monarch england canutus thinking himselfe sufficiently safe long might pretend people eye caused first edwyn sonne king ethelred brother edmund abjure realme yet afterward recalled treacherously murthered owne men body buried tavestock devonshire next two sonnes edmund ironside edward edmund end people might see shed blood innocent alderman upon solemne dayes resort paul doe still use walke gravestone bishop lie interred also king first brought jewes inhabite england likewise made law whosoever forced woman lose genitals time long bowes came first use england weapon france king conquered england weapon england afterkings conquered fra ce enough u beate beate owne weapon king also appointed constable dover castle lord warden cinqueports immunity day affaire church raigne twelfth yeare raigne lanfranke archbishop canterbury held synod london amongst thing removed bishop see small townes great city silliway garment middle upwards onely shirt open r might annoynted archbishop canterbury annoynted three place head shoulder right arme prayer case accustomed covered head linnen cloath hallowed set cap thereon put royall garment uppermost robe archbishop delivered sword beate downe enemy church done two earles put shooes upon feete mantle put archbishop forbad behalfe almighty god presume take upon incensed decree sleighted adjudgeth held enemy religion give power peter bishop winchester abbot reading excommunicate meane time king sent bishop worcester chancellour england others seale hire oppugner indeed divine providence shewed speciall care childhood whereof one two example unfit related one yet young playing one time chesse friend midst game without apparent occasion removed himselfe place sate suddenly fell roofe house great stone stayed place never little beaten braines another example divine providence though happened afterwards prepared great fleete ship journey flanders winchelsey ship meete happened riding harbour horse frighted noyse windmill wind drove violently skrambled leapt mud wall towne neither king horse seene every one judged king could chuse throwne killed yet divine providence horse lighted upon foot king keeping saddle returned safe wing divine providence passed danger tedious journey safely come london fifteenth day august yeare crowned westminster together wife queene eleanor robert kilwarby archbishop canterbury five hundred great horse let loose could take yet outward solemnity great inward joy universall every man applause nobility people good cause beene trained good course piety learning seene government father whose example could learned many good lesson initiated wayes state beene left governour realme presiding parliament father absence three twenty yeares old fit age bearing weight scepter yet advantage wanted feares mindes many could remember prankes played long broken bishop chester parke disorderly manner killed deere himselfe beene committed prison friend pierce gaveston banished realme thing prince might feared comming king seldome doth advancement honour alter men better worse often commonly joyned authority set controlement neither yet feare seene saw endevoured accomplish charge father given deathbed seemed intend nothing lesse nothing wholly breake presently called home beene kept ground sixteene weekes abbey waltham bishop chester walter langton lord treasurer executor father busie preparing funeral sent constable tower arrest imprison wallingford seising upon good king aragon prince edward partly charity succour distressed prince partly policy keepe souldiers exercise undertakes enterprise prosperous one battell thirty thousand hundred thousand hee put king peter possession kingdome though ill rewarded labour ungratefull king would much pay souldiers unfortunate journey prince though came back victory yet brought backe indisposition body never throughly well perhaps poyson given brother duke lancaster though suspected cause distempering enough besides countrey season action selfe may marvelled souldiers came home well came ill howsoever returned presently indisposition body added discontentment minde meanes pay souldiers forced winke could chuse see seeing grieve preyed upon countrey thereupon countrey murmured stop murmuring chancellour bishop rhodes devised new imposition leavying frank every chimney continue five yeares pay prince debt imposition made murmuring though part dominion poict in xaingtonois lymo sin sort consented yet count armigni ck count comminges viscount carmayn many others much distasted complained thereof king france supreme lord upon examination finding complaint thereupon advise councell summons prince edward appeare person answer complaint whereunto prince edw made answere must need appeare would bring threescore thousand men armes appeare certainely brought army summer paris fallen symptomes performed great solemnity sermon king tooke oath archbishop blessed king done tore ff garment strippped shirt annoynted hand head breast shoulder joynts armes cred oyle certaine prayer cl dd first saith king henry sitting one day table said sighing faithfull friend deliver death speech specially noted one sir pier ex presently eight person company went pomfret commanding esquire tooke assay king richard doe saying let eat shall eat long king richard sitting dinner served without assay whereat marvelling demanded esquire duty sir said otherwise commanded sir pier ex newly come king henry king richard heard word tooke carving knife hand stroke squire head saying devill take henry lancaster thee together word sir pier entred chamber eight armed men every bill hand king richard perceiving put table stepping foremost man wrung bill hand slew foure thus came assaile conclusion felled stroke pollaxe sir pier gave upon head blow fell dead though scarce credible man upon bare word without shewing warrant admitted doe fact sir pier thus slaine wept bitterly poore amends heynous trespasse king richard thus dead body embalmed covered lead save face brought london lay paul prince wale father king england second son thomas duke clarence steward england slaine beaufort anjo dyed without issue third son iohn duke bedford married first anne daughter iohn duke burgundie secondly iacoba daughter peter luxenbourgh earle st paul dyed also without issue fourth son humphry brother king henry fifth created duke gloucester generally called good duke two wife dyed without issue yeare buried st albans though vulgar opinion lye buried st paul church king henry fourth daughter blanch elder married lewis barbatus palatine rhene prince elector philippe younger daughter married iohn king denmarke norway personage condition concerning body middle stature slender limbes well proportioned concerning minde serious solid disposition one stood upon legges predecessor done case difficulty refusing needing advice others might confirme better neither merry sad best pleasd opposed like doe good sharpening invention angry flattered sure doe hurt dulling judgement man ever loved lesse doted upon wife good husband uxorious reines passion may know may thought affected crown much ambition compassion oppre sion country could well helpe subject king otherwise may truly say loser crowne great king subject crowne rather gainer hath ever since richer wearing may thinke either weary life longing death else would take upon crusado told skilfu l southsayer dye ierusalem seemes believe death buriall fortysixth yeare age peace home abroad active spirit idle tooke upon crusado great provision made journey ierusalem ala journey ierusalem required provision prayer edward shrine suddenly taken apoplexie thereupon removed abbot westminster house recovering sens finding himselfe strange place asked place told abbot house chamber called ierusalem well said lord mercy upon ierusalem southsayer told dye dyed indeed day march yeare lived sixe forty yeares reigned thirteen halfe worth remembring time sicknesse crowne set upon bolster one fit strong upon men thought directly dead prince comming tooke away crowne suddenly king recovering sens missed crown asking told prince taken whereupon prince called came back crown kneeling said sir judgement griefes seemed directly dead therefore tooke crown right seeing comfort live deliver much joyfully tooke pray god may long live weare selfe well saith king sighing right god knowes saith prince dye king sword shall mai teine right opposer well saith king referre god charge thee blessing thou administer lawes indifferently avoyd flatterer deferre justice sparing mercy turning said god blesse thee mercy word gave champaigne upon st nicholas day yeare queen katherine brought bed son windsor duke bedford henry bishop winchester countesse holland christned name henry whereof king notice propheticke rapture sayd good lord henry monmouth shall small time reigne much get henry borne windsor shall long time reigne lose god done time dolphin layd siege cosney king intentive relieve town duke burgoignes therefore tendredit beene hi owne making overhasty journey overheat himselfe travell comming lys found himselfe ill ease forced remaine send brother duke bedford prosecute designe duke performed dolphin upon approach retired berry whereof mockage called king berry king feaver fl increasing removed boy de vincens growing worse worse within dayes dyed somewhat departure made brother duke bedford lievetenant generall dy regent kingdome france brother duke glocester made protector england son person exhorting true faithfull duke urgo g e unitie amongst loyall young prince serviceable dearly beloved queene hold preserve valour god assistance wonne never conclude contract amitie dolphin duke alanson untill submitted king grac giving god thanks favor blessing bestowed upon midst saying psalme david departed life might justly prayed god david take ot away midst dayes dyed age five six thirty year david account midst number dayes man life though dyed midst dayes yet dyed fulnesse glory may saidiam somerset exeter drawes force worcester whence richard beauchamp bishop salisbury sent offer yorkists full generall pardon would lay arm become loyall subject whereunto answered trust king pardon long queen predominant power might assurance safety would expresse loyalty humbly render service hereupon king advanceth neerer approaching lord armie caused proclamation made whosoever would abandon duke christ deliverance holy church oppressed opposed george earle shrewsbury raised army without commission though resist rebel yet began much troubled whither committed treason never quiet till se king pardon commission proceed time rumour raised amongst souldiers earle well liked rebel cause shew soever made yet come triall would stick joyne take part remove opinion mind caused souldiers come made thirtieth yeere three twentieth november parliament began vvestmins er wherein granted king subsidie spiritualty temporalty colledges chanteries hospitalls given dispose foure twentieth december parliament prorogued day king comming parliament house speaker made oration lord chancelour used answere time king would answer himselfe effect whereof master speaker commended many excellent quality thanked putting mind necessary thanked whole house subsidie giving college chanteries hee promised see bestowed glory god good realme lastly ackowledged love himselfe found fault want love one another love concord concord one calleth another heretick anabaptist againe calleth papist hipocrite onely amongst temporalty even clergy men preach one another inveigh one another without charity discretion stiffe old mumpsimus others curious new sumpsimus none preacheth truly sincerely word god therfore let amended feare serve god charity amongst self supream head soveraigne lord exhort require said act openly read gave royall assent diverse assented whilst oath peace thus taken king bulloigne remaining still king henry possession monsieur de chatillon captain montpleasier began make new bastillion mouth bulloigne naming chatillous garden hereof lord gray vvilton deputy bulloigne advertised king sir thomas palmour requiring know pleasure whither race thing incommodious town let stand king asked advice counsail agreed condition peace ought wise infringed therefore let bastillian stand whereupon king caused secretary lord paget write letter lord gray purpose called sir thomas palmour secretly bidding tell lord gray whatsoever written letter yet speed possible race fortification ground sir thomas palmour replying message word mouth contrary leter would never beleeved wel said king tell bid leave choice upon comming back sir thomas palmour lord gray called counsaile shewing th king letter withall sir thomas palmours message asked advise case doe agreed without question letter followed message lord gray himselfe said nothing caused message wtitten verbatim sir thomas palmours mouth counsaile set hand done night following issued forth company armed men pioners aud overthrew yet discharge place held sent writing answer withall generall pardon would desist lay downe armes sedicious growing outragious fairer intreated finding unable subsist owne estate began thinke upon spoyle city first came excetour demanded entrance citizen refusing fell set fire ga e citizen prevented casting wood maintaining fire till cast halfe moone within upon seditious attempted enter presently hewen cut peeces mined wals laid powder rammed mouth citizen prevented also making countermine whereinto poured plenty water wet powder could fired lord russell lord privie seale beene sent downe suppresse commotion lay huntington expecting force whilst citizen excetour twelve dayes together endured great famine faine eat horse make bread course bran moulded cloathes otherwise would cleave together last lord gray came lord russell supply force many conflict rebel forced raise siedge excetour thereby freed city many misery king afterward gave mannour evyland reward loyalty rebel lord wentworth suspected queen elizabeth time arraigned betraying acquitted peeres callice thus duke army marched guysnes five mile distant whereof captaine lord gray wilton held siedge battery five six dayes great valour resolution appeared nothing inferiour enemy multitude yet last overlaid number importunde souldiers much owne made composition towne castle wholly rendered himselfe officer remaine prisoner depart armour baggage lord gray afterward ransomed foure twenty thousand crownes duke guise considering guysnes would costly castle kept dangerous neighbour callice recovered raced bulwarkes fortification ground guysnes thus remained nothing within english pale little castle hammes whereof captaine lord edward dudley considering though naturally strongly scituate invironed fen marsh yet little helpe art fortification assured duke guyse would speedily come upon secretly night garrison departed flanders castle taken duke guyse losse castle english lost footing terra firma king england reality title france nothing left nudum nomen presently french king caused mariage eldest sonne francis dolphin mary steward sole heire iames fift king scotland solemnized whereupon great
